entities.description: The United States, referred to as the U.S., is the country where the Lakota cultural objects were kept before being returned to the Oglala Sioux Tribe. It is also involved in supporting Ukraine's military efforts by preparing to ship artillery rounds and rockets through NATO.

entities.description: "The New York Times Company is a media organization that published the article on the events in France and the repatriation of Native American cultural objects."
"Élisabeth Borne is the Prime Minister of France who informed the National Assembly about the government's decision to raise the retirement age, facing heckling and opposition."
"Emmanuel Macron is the President of France who opted to pass legislation raising the retirement age without a full parliamentary vote, causing tension and controversy."
"The National Assembly, or lower house, is where Élisabeth Borne informed lawmakers about the government's decision to raise the retirement age, facing opposition."
"France is the geographical location where the government's decision to raise the retirement age is causing controversy and tension."
"The Yellow Vest movement was a large-scale protest in France against proposed fuel increases and other measures during Macron's first term, marking his presidency."
"Wounded Knee is a location in South Dakota, the site of a bloody massacre by American soldiers against Native Americans, where cultural objects were returned to the Oglala Sioux Tribe."

The Oglala Sioux Tribe, also known as the Lakota, is a Native American tribe to which cultural objects and belongings were returned after more than a century. These items, including moccasins, sacred pipes, ritual clothing, and beaded leather bags, were believed to have been taken from Wounded Knee after the 1890 massacre and were kept in the Founders Museum in Barre, Mass.
"The Founders Museum, previously known as a small-town library museum in Barre, Mass., agreed to return the sought-after items to the Oglala Sioux Tribe."
"Ukraine is the geographical location where the military is engaged in an intense bombardment of Bakhmut, raising concerns about ammunition supply for future campaigns."
"Bakhmut is the eastern city in Ukraine that the Ukrainian military is trying to hold, firing thousands of artillery shells a day, which is unsustainable."
"NATO is an international organization that, along with the United States and Britain, is preparing to ship artillery rounds and rockets to support Ukraine's military efforts."

The United States, referred to as the U.S., is the country where the Lakota cultural objects were kept before being returned to the Oglala Sioux Tribe. It is also involved in supporting Ukraine's military efforts by preparing to ship artillery rounds and rockets through NATO.
"Barre, Mass. is the location of the Founders Museum, from where the Lakota cultural objects were returned to the Oglala Sioux Tribe."
"Congress is the legislative body that passed a law setting up a protocol for the return of Native American cultural heritage and human remains."
"The N.C.A.A. is the organization that hosts the tournament where the 15th-seeded Tigers achieved a significant upset against Arizona."
"The Tigers are the 15th-seeded team that stunned Arizona, a No. 2 seed, in the N.C.A.A. tournament."
"Arizona is the No. 2 seed team that was stunned by the 15th-seeded Tigers in the N.C.A.A. tournament."
"Kyiv is the location where the Pentagon raised concerns with Ukrainian officials about the nonstop artillery firing in the defense of Bakhmut."
"Thomas Gibbons-Neff is one of the journalists who co-authored the article on Ukraine's military situation in Bakhmut."
